summary: I/O errors writing to PFS from within Slurm jobs

updates.details: Issue reported where I/O errors occur when writing to PFS storage volumes from Slurm jobs. Appears to be memory-related: initial advice is to increase memory allocation for job. Investigation underway with vendor, awaiting further advice.

summary: Scheduled maintenance of SSD storage for software upgrade

updates.details: Advance notice: SSD storage at-risk on afternoon of Tuesday 22nd April 2025. Disruption possible though unlikely, but would have wide-reaching impact, affecting user home directories, /work/scratch-nopw2 and GWS 'SMF' volumes with paths /gws/smf/*.
We are aware of another interruption to RAL site network over the Easter weekend which will have affected LOTUS jobs and other CEDA and JASMIN services.
Further short (~10min) interruptions planned for 14:00 and 17:00 today 22 April, and 17:00 tomorrow 23 April.

There was an issue with Slurm controller service 19:30 - 20:30 last night. Users would have experienced Slurm commands hanging, and may not have been able to submit jobs. It is probable that running jobs may have failed/timed out. Possible residual failures/time outs this morning. Slurm controller service has been restarted and jobs are running, Slurm commands running as expected. Further support actions in progress.

Further problems earlier today (10:30-12:40) mean that some users needed to resubmit their jobs, however a restart of the controller appears to have resolved the issue for now. A further interventiion is planned for our scheduled maintenance day on 29 April.
